questions.question_text: Which two static routes are not maintained in the routing table? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: The correct answer is B & D, I created a Named Address Route in my firewall and apears in the routing table.
B & D are corrects - Infrastructure_Manual-6.2, p. 14

questions.question_text: Which downstream FortiGate VDOM is used to join the Security Fabric when split-task VDOM is enabled on all FortiGate devices?

discussion.content:
If you enable split-task VDOM mode on the upstream FGT device, it can allow downstream FGT devices to join the Security Fabric in the root and FG-Traffic VDOMs.
If split-task VDOM mode is enabled on the downstream FortiGate, it can only connect to the upstream FortiGate through the downstream FortiGate interface on the root VDOM.
B is correct.

choices.C: Forward to primary and secondary DNS

questions.question_text:
An administrator wants to configure a FortiGate as a DNS server. FotiGate must use a DNS database first, and then relay all irresolvable queries to an external
DNS server. Which DNS method must you use?
Which two FortiGate configuration tasks will create a route in the policy route table? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Creating an SD-WAN rule to route traffic based on link latency
choices.D: Creating a static route with an Internet services object
choices.C: Creating a static route with a named address object
choices.A: Creating an SD-WAN route for individual member interfaces

discussion.content:
B & D are correct. SD-WAN rules are treated as policy routes.
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.0.0/handbook/793167/configuring-sd-wan-rules

choices.C: Because deep-inspection must be enabled for FortiGate to fully scan FTP traffic
choices.D: Because FortiGate needs to be operating in flow-based inspection mode in order to scan FTP traffic
choices.A: Because the proxy options profile needs to scan FTP traffic on a non-standard port
choices.B: Because the FortiSandbox signature database is required to successfully scan FTP traffic

discussion.content: A is correct - ftp is working on port 223
I think, it's C. There is a warning in log, cannot .... FTP over TLS.

i dont know whats correct but standard port for FTP is 21. 
Like its used in the exhibit. has anyone good explaination?

comments.content: If you look at the Filezilla screenshot, the person is using ftp on port 223 (non-standard port)
